user_persona: A new entrepreneur looking to join the community to read inspiring startup stories.
user_goal: Successfully register for a new account and then log in to access personalized features.

narrative_steps.title: Switching to Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Sarah visits the mini-program for the first time and wants to create an account. She sees the login form but clicks on the 'Register' tab instead.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Register' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The view switches to show the registration form with fields for username, email, and password.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah fills out her desired username, email, and password. After reviewing, she presses Enter to submit the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in username, email, and password fields. Press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system registers Sarah successfully and displays a confirmation message.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In After Registration
narrative_steps.description: Now that Sarah has an account, she switches to the login tab and enters her credentials to access her profile.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Login' tab. Enter registered email and password. Click 'Log In'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Sarah is authenticated and redirected to her dashboard with a welcome message.

user_persona: A busy founder seeking inspiration from tech startups.
user_goal: Browse articles specifically under the 'Technology' category.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Category Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the app and notices several category labels above the main content area. He looks for 'Technology'.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the horizontal navigation bar for categories.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple clickable category labels are visible, including one labeled 'Technology'.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Technology Category
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on the 'Technology' label to filter articles relevant to his interests.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Technology' category label.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The article listing updates dynamically to display only technology-related articles.

user_persona: A reader interested in finding articles about funding strategies.
user_goal: Find articles related to startup funding using the search feature.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Jamie notices the search bar at the top of the page and decides to look up articles on startup funding.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The search bar becomes focused and ready for input.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Query and Initiating Search
narrative_steps.description: Jamie types 'startup funding' into the search bar and hits Enter to initiate the search.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'startup funding' into the search bar. Press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of articles matching the query 'startup funding' is displayed below the search bar.

user_persona: A serial entrepreneur who likes saving insightful reads.
user_goal: Collect an article they find particularly useful for future reference.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Article Preview
narrative_steps.description: Taylor scrolls through the latest articles and finds one titled 'Building Resilient Startups'. Next to the title is a heart icon.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the heart-shaped icon next to the article title.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The heart icon appears unfilled, indicating the article isn't currently in the user's collection.

narrative_steps.title: Collecting the Article
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the heart icon to add the article to their personal collection.
narrative_steps.action: Click the heart-shaped icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The heart icon turns filled instantly, confirming the article was added to the user's collection.

requirement_tested: Article sharing capability to external platforms
user_persona: An influencer wanting to promote valuable content.
user_goal: Share an inspiring article to their LinkedIn network.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Sharing Options
narrative_steps.description: Jordan finishes reading an impactful article and wants to share it with colleagues on LinkedIn. They scroll down to the bottom of the article.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the end of the article content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A row of branded social media icons including LinkedIn is visible beneath the article.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Share to LinkedIn
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks the LinkedIn icon to begin sharing the article.
narrative_steps.action: Click the LinkedIn icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A native sharing dialog opens pre-filled with the articleâ€™s URL and title, ready for posting.

requirement_tested: Reading history tracking for logged-in users
user_persona: A frequent visitor who revisits past reads occasionally.
user_goal: Revisit an article they read earlier this week.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Reading History
narrative_steps.description: Riley logs in and wants to return to an article they remember reading a few days ago. They go to their profile to find the reading history section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the user profile or dedicated history section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A chronological list of recently read articles appears, showing titles, authors, and dates.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Previously Read Article
narrative_steps.description: Riley locates the article in the history list and clicks on it to revisit its contents.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the article entry in the history list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The full article page loads, and the visit is recorded again in the reading history.

user_persona: A meticulous reader who organizes saved articles by importance.
user_goal: Remove an outdated article from their collection and reorder favorites.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Collection Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Morgan logs in and navigates to their collection dashboard to manage saved articles.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the collection management dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A scrollable grid or list of collected articles is displayed, each with edit controls like trash bins and drag handles.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Unwanted Article
narrative_steps.description: Morgan identifies an article no longer needed and clicks the trash bin icon next to it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the trash bin icon beside the unwanted article.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The article disappears from the list, and a DELETE request is sent to remove it from the backend collection.

narrative_steps.title: Reordering Favorite Articles
narrative_steps.description: Morgan drags a key article higher in the list to make it easier to access later.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the article card upward in the list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The article moves to the new position, and the order update is persisted via a PATCH request.

user_persona: A commuter checking articles on their phone during travel.
user_goal: Effortlessly browse articles on a mobile device.

narrative_steps.title: Loading App on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Casey opens the mini-program on their smartphone while commuting. The screen adapts automatically.
narrative_steps.action: Open the app on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts appropriately for smaller screens; article cards stack vertically and navigation collapses into a menu.

requirement_tested: Background styling with old lace color scheme
user_goal: Verify that all pages use the specified background color.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Patricia inspects the app visually to confirm that the background uses the correct old lace color as per brand guidelines.
narrative_steps.action: Visually inspect the background color across multiple pages.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All backgrounds render consistently in #FDF5E6 (old lace) without any unexpected color variations.

requirement_tested: Interface elements styled in rosy brown color
user_persona: A frontend developer validating theme implementation.
user_goal: Confirm that interactive elements use the correct accent color.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Interface Elements
narrative_steps.description: Devon reviews the interface components such as buttons and category tags to verify adherence to the rosy brown theme.
narrative_steps.action: Observe primary interface components like buttons and active links.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All specified interactive elements utilize #BC8F8F (rosy brown) as their accent color.

requirement_tested: Article display with titles, summaries, and metadata
user_persona: A casual reader scanning for interesting topics.
user_goal: Quickly assess whether an article is worth reading based on preview info.

narrative_steps.title: Scanning Article Previews
narrative_steps.description: Blake scrolls through the homepage feed and scans article cards for engaging headlines and summaries.
narrative_steps.action: View the article preview cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each card clearly shows a headline-sized title, short excerpt, author name, publish date, and category tag.

user_persona: A regular user navigating between content sections.
user_goal: Switch between different article categories using the main navigation.

narrative_steps.title: Using Sidebar Menu
narrative_steps.description: Ellis accesses the fixed-position sidebar menu to switch from 'Marketing' to 'Finance' articles.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Finance' link in the sidebar navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Main content area updates to show finance-related articles, highlighting 'Finance' in the menu.

user_goal: Update their bio and preferred categories in their profile settings.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Profile Information
narrative_steps.description: Quinn goes to their profile page and edits their biography and selects new preferred categories.
narrative_steps.action: Modify the bio text field and select categories from the multi-select dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Changes are reflected in the form fields and selections are visually confirmed.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Updated Profile
narrative_steps.description: After making changes, Quinn clicks the save button to apply the updates.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save Changes' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Updated profile data is submitted via PATCH request and the page refreshes with the new information.

requirement_tested: Search results display with filtering options
user_goal: Filter general search results to show only recent articles.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Initial Search
narrative_steps.description: Taylor searches for 'growth hacking', which returns many results spanning various dates.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'growth hacking' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Search results appear along with collapsible filter options on the side panel.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Date Filter
narrative_steps.description: Taylor expands the date filter section and chooses 'Last Month' to narrow down the results.
narrative_steps.action: Expand the date filter panel and select 'Last Month'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update instantly to show only articles published within the last month without reloading the page.

requirement_tested: Social sharing integration for major platforms
user_goal: Easily share curated articles across multiple social channels.

narrative_steps.title: Preparing to Share Across Platforms
narrative_steps.description: Zoe discovers a compelling article and wants to post it on both Twitter and Facebook simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the social sharing buttons beneath the article.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Branded icons for Twitter and Facebook are visible and styled in rosy brown.

narrative_steps.title: Sharing to Multiple Networks
narrative_steps.description: Zoe clicks the Twitter icon first, shares the article, then repeats the process for Facebook.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Twitter icon, complete the share, then click the Facebook icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Native sharing dialogs open sequentially, each pre-populated with correct metadata for optimal display.
